![](http://elink.turing.ac.uk/o/4/eyJhaSI6NTkyMDc5NzIsImUiOiJ2aGVsbG9uQHR1cmluZy5hYy51ayIsInJpIjoiY29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi03NGVlMjdiODM3MTA0N2FlODJiYTM4ZDI1M2MwN2RjMSIsInJxIjoicDEtYjI0MTY1LWJhM2U3NDYzOGM5ZDQ1N2E4MzA1NjYyZTk2ZmM0YjgyIiwicGgiOm51bGx9/OFGuLPgVMytQCjckxBKTkQ)

Click [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fm%2F1%2F59207972%2Fp1-b24165-ba3e74638c9d457a8305662e96fc4b82%2F1%2F215%2F2b9270e2-461d-4f64-bab7-fc885ed6c22a&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724040450%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=qmNXENLCJclcG17QwbUIRq5k8RLyHpsv8NxZSR1fTGY%3D&reserved=0) if you are having trouble viewing this message.
![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/bannernewsletter.png)

This is June's Turing-Roche newsletter! Here you can find what's new in the Turing-Roche strategic partnership and opportunities, events and news from both the Alan Turing Institute, Roche and wider relevant networks.

Our [five year partnership](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FPcCP_rSC2aJcDJiA7ZX7tA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724063376%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=Gvfmy%2F7VDmrXuYudDxPZ7%2BRHrPy51aI7gEROP9BWvL0%3D&reserved=0) was officially launched in June 2021. Our 'North Star' is **to enable the generation of insights to better understand patient and disease heterogeneity and its relevance to clinical outcomes at an unprecedented level of precision in order to improve clinical care.**

We are developing multiple research activities over the five years to work towards our North Star, as well as building strong connections and collaborations between the Alan Turing Institute, Roche and the broader community.

If you have anything you'd like featured in a future newsletter then please get in touch with Vicky Hellon, Community Manager for the partnership at <vhellon@turing.ac.uk>

If you would like to share this newsletter with relevant colleagues please direct them to sign-up [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FhSt_Bwpp-r7K5VtC3F3e5A&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724082590%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=AmqtXyWSuspzzYPTOjNcvv4p7Y7VNDqZE6g0QlRCY1Q%3D&reserved=0).

## Turing-Roche Strategic Partnership Updates
![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/photo-1457530378978-8bac673b8062.jfif)

### AI In Pathology Event: Research Meets Reality

**18 July 2024**

Organised by our Turing-Roche Theme Lead Chris Banerji and our Community Scholar, Tom Butters, this one day workshop aims to bring together a wide range of pathologists, data scientists and researchers to discuss progress in applying AI technologies to problems in pathology and potential ways forward. The day will feature keynote and lighting talks, as well as networking and breakout sessions. 

In-person and virtual regsitration options are available- find out more [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FbgPSOuBHStQ1Cg0Xk4J2DQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724095470%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=1uWYATAoiMAFSTCcTrRRxAkiXJ%2Fm7Cp%2FPVX7DzO2YfI%3D&reserved=0).

### Partnership team write Turing Way chapter on 'Ambassador Schemes' 

Our Research Community Manager Vicky Hellon has written a new chapter on '[Ambassador Schemes](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Fa9t6zICOWINC5NspOYIFtQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724107891%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=VbWlpzFZmVOgiwnb2xxIUO%2FfoWbjzPUQ2VspeIclTz0%3D&reserved=0)' for the [Turing Way](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPXA5dTZVMzlxcmkxbTZfTnBHMzI0YUxUSi1veFpUS0puVVlDZkZOUWFjdGlxSlByRWo2OGpwWVRwTGlyS2FuQ0MmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi03NGVlMjdiODM3MTA0N2FlODJiYTM4ZDI1M2MwN2RjMSZlc2lkPWZhMjFjMzQ5LWQyMjgtZWYxMS04NDBhLTdjMWU1MjJkNzEyYyJ9%2FDAqSbWSZqvF2nWRKMVyICA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724118857%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=rMS%2FUcKsu%2F15faqUWwRUAflsYkccK6FXzqW5Hf0J9M8%3D&reserved=0), a handbook on how to do reproducible, ethical and collaborative data science. The text is based on the partnership experiences of setting up the [Turing-Roche Community Scholar Scheme](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPXA5dTZVMzlxcmkxbTZfTnBHMzI0YUxUSi1veFpUS0puVVlDZkZOUWFjdGlxSlByRWo2OGpwWVRwTGlyS2FuQ0MmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi03NGVlMjdiODM3MTA0N2FlODJiYTM4ZDI1M2MwN2RjMSZlc2lkPWZhMjFjMzQ5LWQyMjgtZWYxMS04NDBhLTdjMWU1MjJkNzEyYyJ9%2FgQkfGNbZSgnscXJUH3o3RQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724129339%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=2EJPiDoMBrJbrQD%2BT4dQ6g%2B93ycbqNOC5ugvIjj5cG0%3D&reserved=0) and aims to be a guide for anyone setting up this kind of programme. We would encourage anyone who runs or has been part of one of these type of schemes to contribute a case study to this chapter on their experiences.

### Partnership team member Leandra Bräuninger takes part in panel at Geneva Health Forum Conference

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/leandrapanel.jpg)

From 27-29 May the Geneva Health Forum Conference took place alongside the World Health Assembly (WHA). As the WHA convened a political audience, the GHF Conference provided a unique platform conveying the perspectives of scientists, medical practitioners and field actors on the main challenges and opportunities for global health. 

Our predictive modelling theme team member Leandra Bräuninger took part in a panel on 'Harnessing AI for Global Health Improvements'. In conversation with other experts, including the AI lead of the WHO, academic and field experts of digital global health, Leandra discussed the social implications of applying AI in global health. The need for transparency, context-awareness and bringing the affected population into the decision-making process from the very beginning were some of the main points Leandra made. The panel showed clearly the growing importance of a thoroughly equitable approach to AI in healthcare across the globe.

## Current News and Opportunities from The Alan Turing Institute and Roche

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/group_study_working__0.jpg)

### Applications open for September's Turing Data Study Group
**Application Deadline: 07 July 2024**
**Data Study Group Event: 02-13 September 2024**

Data Study Groups (DSG) are 'collaborative hackathons' hosted at The Alan Turing Institute which bring together organisations from industry, government and the third sector, with talented multi-disciplinary researchers from academia. Applications are now open for people looking to participate in September's DSG which includes challenges from:

-   British Geological Survey - Identifying potential for carbon capture and storage in rock.
-   Transport for London - Identifying physical assets on the London Underground from the point cloud.
-   UCL CHIMERA - Morbidity prediction using preoperative Cardiopulmonary Exercise Test results.

Find out more and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPXA5dTZVMzlxcmkxbTZfTnBHMzI0YUxUSi1veFpUS0puVVlDZkZOUWFjdGlxSlByRWo2OGpwWVRwTGlyS2FuQ0MmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi03NGVlMjdiODM3MTA0N2FlODJiYTM4ZDI1M2MwN2RjMSZlc2lkPWZhMjFjMzQ5LWQyMjgtZWYxMS04NDBhLTdjMWU1MjJkNzEyYyJ9%2FdfhIqIVyu22zvaSaZEQC8g&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724140751%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=4J%2F24Q3DDsMdhgSbm4Xn%2BaEJLcL5j88H16PFQI0T3wU%3D&reserved=0).

### Roche Internships for Scientific Exchange

The Roche Internships for Scientific Exchange (RiSE) Programme invites PhD and medical students to gain insight into drug discovery and development at Roche. These 9-12 month internships based in Basel, Switzerland allow participants to perform exploratory research embedded in a research, clinical or analytical team within drug development programmes in the areas of neuroscience and rare diseases. There is a monthly internship salary, travel expenses, accommodation support and reimbursed costs for Swiss work permit application. Further information and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPXA5dTZVMzlxcmkxbTZfTnBHMzI0YUxUSi1veFpUS0puVVlDZkZOUWFjdGlxSlByRWo2OGpwWVRwTGlyS2FuQ0MmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi03NGVlMjdiODM3MTA0N2FlODJiYTM4ZDI1M2MwN2RjMSZlc2lkPWZhMjFjMzQ5LWQyMjgtZWYxMS04NDBhLTdjMWU1MjJkNzEyYyJ9%2FlTg8-veNiYU_POpjgj4QiQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724151311%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=oVU%2BJ015yow8Ri1R2KRVJwuTaL%2FvtNIkYIjVm8ycbAA%3D&reserved=0).

## Events
![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/ags-0057_800-px-wide.jpg)

### Clinical AI Skills Town Hall Events
**17 and 20 June 2024**

The [Clinical AI Interest Group](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Fs7_hJKXuuWzJSkgM2XJkdQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724178712%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=4czPijC6INhDaFBCed%2B6P5NgcVgyusFvUDjJYeB3QPc%3D&reserved=0) are holding two online sessions 'Clinical AI Skills Townhalls' on the 17 June 10am-11am and 20 June 4pm-5pm to bring together a wide range of health professionals to understand the current problem around AI skills in the NHS workforce and what could be done about it.  

Attendees can discuss the AI upskilling needs of the NHS workforce, how this can be tackled and about any current work in this area. These sessions will be used to gather ideas and current resources in this area to form an idea of the next steps that can be taken. Find out more and how to register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FI6vIQ2bjTv4UYVYHZYRHkQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724187745%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=Gs%2F040QoCH5HfCFpcnNZoS8fN%2F%2FPCsevz%2B9ACsurCyw%3D&reserved=0).

### Turing Public lecture: Rigour, imagination and production in data-driven science
**20 June 2024**

The steady expansion in the availability and reach of observational data has prompted much-needed introspection into data analysis practice. This public lecture features three internationally-standout scientists from academia and industry, Andrew Gelman, Jessica Hullman and Hadley Wickham, whose talks will cover how to challenge and interrogate in data-based research, techniques for imagining uncertainty and variation in observational data, and how data-driven analyses can be put into production.

Register for this in-person event being held at Kings College London [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F7JkSbP18gwR7kU3jaIcvuw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724196925%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=lIfySisxXzznSaHwDzffNLdXyiA40JXEi0Gix4cGX9w%3D&reserved=0).

### Science and Technology Facilities Council (STFC) School on Data Intensive Science 2024
**Registration Deadline: 21 June 2024**
**School: 15-19 July 2024**

This week-long School hosted at the University of Liverpool will provide PhD students that are active in data science additional skills to support their research, help them make industry placements a success and provide advice concerning possible career pathways in industry. The event consists of hands-on workshops, plenary talks, group discussions and evening events. 

The School is free to attend for STFC-funded students and students in one of STFC's CDTs on Data Intensive Science, and also other students are welcome to attend. Further information and registration [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Fyzns8XfTcUu1JZKwKoUlPA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724206233%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=Zvf84N7thbHqDoROGvnu4iY6CrAdLk%2FaewWwKcyg0LE%3D&reserved=0).

### EPSRC Health Data Workshop
**24 September 2024**

The Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council (EPSRC) are hosting a workshop on health data for research taking place virtually.The aims of the workshop are to signpost guidance and resources about health data access and responsible use of health data and to allow researchers to identify any challenges around health data access, identify gaps in guidance and training and identify how EPSRC can help. Register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPXA5dTZVMzlxcmkxbTZfTnBHMzI0YUxUSi1veFpUS0puVVlDZkZOUWFjdGlxSlByRWo2OGpwWVRwTGlyS2FuQ0MmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi03NGVlMjdiODM3MTA0N2FlODJiYTM4ZDI1M2MwN2RjMSZlc2lkPWZhMjFjMzQ5LWQyMjgtZWYxMS04NDBhLTdjMWU1MjJkNzEyYyMvcmVnaXN0cmF0aW9uIn0%2FJjcHTIphFgefmrWQPTXPww&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724215295%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=Lm4ZHtkyF8HrB4C%2BYBtZqAJ83MGXTHg0TYrRv5rqcas%3D&reserved=0).

### AIMDay (Academic and Industry Meeting Day) Civic AI and HealthTech
**02 October 2024**

The University of Liverpool will host AIMday Civic AI and HealthTech on 2 October 2024 at the Civic Health Innovation Labs situated in the Liverpool Science Park. This event will explore research and collaboration in relation to development, adoption and implementation of civic AI, digital health data and health technologies. More info and how to participate [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPXA5dTZVMzlxcmkxbTZfTnBHMzI0YUxUSi1veFpUS0puVVlDZkZOUWFjdGlxSlByRWo2OGpwWVRwTGlyS2FuQ0MmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi03NGVlMjdiODM3MTA0N2FlODJiYTM4ZDI1M2MwN2RjMSZlc2lkPWZhMjFjMzQ5LWQyMjgtZWYxMS04NDBhLTdjMWU1MjJkNzEyYyJ9%2F2bdlvNBo5K1Dll7Cg6LgKg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724221944%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=UNC2PT%2FK0ZIqsvvzabe904mjIRoxUiIZXBX7r3lbzD8%3D&reserved=0).

### Explainable AI in Biology Conference 2024
**15-18 October 2024**

The Explainable AI in Biology Conference is dedicated to exploring the latest advancements in applying explainable and responsible AI techniques to genomics and biology. As AI and machine learning become increasingly prevalent in biology, there is a growing need for more transparent and interpretable models that can provide meaningful insights. This event is free and hybrid, due to generous support by the Wellcome Sanger Institute. Find out more and how to register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FlJeD7M1_mu5SycKCwMEJiQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724228084%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=tOk6VEZinFi00giZYFsi52OqDNxPg%2FyOWfq6VfB3j0Q%3D&reserved=0).
## Other Opportunities

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/alex-shutin-204369-unsplash.jpg)

### PhD Studentship in Creating Cardiac Digital Twins, Imperial College London
**Application Deadline: 30 June 2024**

**PhD Start Date: 01 October 2024**

The National Heart and Lung Institute, Imperial College are inviting applications for a 3-year PhD studentship from candidates with a Master's degree in Bioengineering or a related discipline. This PhD will aim to create computational physiological models that represent how the cardiovascular system adapts to changes in conditions and demands throughout the day, tune these models to represent individual patients and forecast patients response to medications and how this changes under different lifestyle conditions. More info and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FwTvUHUtPlDRHlTFZQ70YKw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724235124%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=NT9pu%2BnX%2FGMGgpxU2Rx2BgmCPtdT8fFaT4EwMhOux5M%3D&reserved=0).

### New Masters Course in Advanced Artificial Intelligence at University of Sussex
**Application Deadline: 01 August 2024 (International), 01 September 2024 (UK)**

This new, specially designed Masters course is targeted at students interested in pursuing a career in AI research and development and goes beyond basic principles. It offers research-focused training that will equip students with the skills and knowledge for doctoral study, and industrial AI research or engineering roles. All relevant details can be found on the course webpage [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F5Cw_mM-BDNM9bayYalMVjQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724241281%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=mm9svFOwFaeEgaNVebTLBP17ha5%2FuQBvMocgNh9t9sg%3D&reserved=0). 

### Harkness Fellowships in Health Care Policy and Practice
**Application Deadline: 01 November 2024**

The Commonwealth Fund, in collaboration with the Health Foundation and the National Institute for Health and Care Research, invites mid-career professionals -- including government policymakers, researchers, clinical leaders, health care executives, and journalists -- to apply for its Harkness Fellowships. This is a unique opportunity to spend 12 months in the United States as a Harkness Fellow in Health Care Policy and Practice. Find out more and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FsBe-_chCjyT975AFKcYw2g&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724247213%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=ZnIJJdBgN17Y5dZRP4iWajMllR6NS3RvJ5wDkVRGwNk%3D&reserved=0).

## Featured Community Scholar of the Month

In September 2023 we welcomed our first cohort of Turing-Roche Community Scholars: 10 UK PhD students who are joining the partnership for 12 months to develop community-based projects for the partnership, alongside their ongoing PhD studies. Each month we are featuring a different scholar in our newsletter.

You can find out more about our community scholars [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FiJymXD138XKgPDIFtEEQsQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724253041%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=159HRaUS8wTEeXoxXPhz%2BxfbXTuJvvngCOf%2BK0ChaH4%3D&reserved=0). You can also see more about their plans for their projects [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FcRr-gl_kUUAfDz5pCwQrbw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724258871%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=kznS%2BKwojBGJauJb21tdH0yc1pSWNo6MhbtvkryjLa0%3D&reserved=0).

This month's scholar is Zeena Shawa, from University College London.

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/zeena_shawa.jpeg)

**Tell us a little bit about yourself and your current research:**

Hello! I'm Zeena; a PhD student based at the Centre for Medical Image Computing in University College London with a background in Biomedical Engineering. My research has several sub-projects but is primarily based on the heterogeneity of neurodegenerative diseases. Specifically, I performed subtyping and staging of Parkinson's disease patients based on their structural MRI scans and examined if the subtypes have a unique longitudinal clinical trajectory (they did not). I am also examining if there is a relationship between the area (or change) of specific hippocampal sub-regions and the severity of cognitive symptoms in Parkinson's. Lastly, I am assessing the sensitivity of different brain-age models, which have been primarily trained on less diverse data, to Alzheimer's disease in different ethnic groups

**What is your planned community scholar project? Why is this of interest to you?**

For my community scholar project, I am adding a chapter to the Turing Way on Data Missingness. The availability and size of datasets are increasing; however, the completeness and quality of these datasets is not always guaranteed, and missing data can happen for many reasons. During my PhD missing data has been a frequent issue and has limited the statistical power of the analysis we conducted.  Therefore, I am interested in learning more about data missingness, for somewhat selfish reasons. But, as this is not a problem unique to my PhD, I thought creating a resource that is openly available and that others can contribute would be valuable for other students and researchers more widely.

**What is your favourite board game?**

Escape the Dark Castle! (For those familiar with video games, it feels like a simpler board-game version of the rogue-like video game "Darkest Dungeon".) In this co-operative board game, you are a team of players that have awoken in the depths of a castle filled with horrid creatures and traps almost at every turn. You need to get through the 15 "rooms" (or instances) ahead of you and then defeat the monster guarding the door to your escape from the dark castle. As there are many cards that can make up the "rooms", different characters with varying stats, and different items, (plus the randomness of rolling dice), each playthrough is completely different. One run may be blessed with good luck, while another doomed from the start. It doesn't take too long to play through and is good fun especially with some atmospheric music in the background! 

## Publication of the Month

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/patrick-tomasso-oaqk7qqnh_c-unsplash2.jpg)

**Modeling the 3D Geometry of the Cortical Surface With Genetic Ancestry**

This month's selected publication is [this paper](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPXA5dTZVMzlxcmkxbTZfTnBHMzI0YUxUSi1veFpUS0puVVlDZkZOUWFjdGlxSlByRWo2OGpwWVRwTGlyS2FuQ0MmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi03NGVlMjdiODM3MTA0N2FlODJiYTM4ZDI1M2MwN2RjMSZlc2lkPWZhMjFjMzQ5LWQyMjgtZWYxMS04NDBhLTdjMWU1MjJkNzEyYyJ9%2FUu0KQOO-SqrrflJuCRrmqg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf81fc1cdc9544a58bf5808dc8b98984f%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638538734724265042%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=7xDh9WIqQ%2FqYuPTTYlSKRgF0WEHdXMv5iAez4uEzw1o%3D&reserved=0), chosen by our featured Community Scholar Zeena Shawa.

'I was recently recommended this paper as it is relevant to a short talk I will be giving at the Organization for Human Brain Mapping conference this year.  It's a super interesting (and short, so time-friendly) read explaining the differences in brain cortical anatomy due to genetic ancestry. Trying to ensure our research is fair and equitable regardless of ethnicity, to implement it in practice is important. It is interesting to think on how declared ethnicity and genetic ancestry may not always match, and the implications this may have to downstream analysis.'
